name: Invert Binary Tree

similar_questions.title: Reverse Odd Levels of Binary Tree

title: Invert Binary Tree
content:
Given the root of a binary tree, invert the tree, and return its root.

 

Example 1:

Input: root = [4,2,7,1,3,6,9]
Output: [4,7,2,9,6,3,1]

Example 2:

Input: root = [2,1,3]
Output: [2,3,1]

Example 3:

Input: root = []
Output: []

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [0, 100].
  • -100 <= Node.val <= 100

discussion_posts.name: Vidhaan_J
discussion_posts.content: Can you guys please upvote so I can gain reputation?\n

discussion_posts.name: ohangP
discussion_posts.content:
Tip (Detailed Explanation): 


a) Recursive Approach: 

1. check whether the root is null or not.. 
2. go to the left most node of tree using RECURSION and store node. 
3. go to the right most node of tree using RECURSION and store node.
4. swap both stored node.
5. return root

-- Time Complexity: O(n)
-- Space Complexity: O(n)


b) Iterative Approach:

1. create Queue
2. check whether the root is null or not.
3. add root to the queue.
4. loop until queue is not empty and then remove element from queue and store it. Then, check for left and right element and add to queue.
Finally, swap the element.
5. return root.

-- Time Complexity: O(n)
-- Space Complexity: O(n)
